protocol.name: P-TABM-103
protocol.text: RNA was extracted from the bulked plants using TRIzol as per the manufacturer’s protocol (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA, USA), followed by purification on RNeasy columns (Qiagen, Valencia, CA, USA).

protocol.name: P-TABM-131
protocol.text: Seeds of Arabidopsis thaliana accessions Bay-0 and Sha were obtained from ABRC through TAIR (www.arabidopsis.org).  A factorial experiment was conducted with two biological replicates of the two accessions.  For each biological replicate , multiple plants (~50) per accession were grown in a growth chamber under short day conditions (8 hr light at 100-120 microEinsteins, 20 degrees C day/20 degrees C night) to maintain plants in the vegetative phase for six weeks.  The growth chambers used a combination of metal halide, mercury vapor, and incandescent lamps. Plants were watered with half-strength Hoagland's solution.  JA and/or Silwet treatment: Six-week-old plants were sprayed with 0.10 mM JA (jasmonic acid, Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA)  in 0.02% Silwet L77 to run-off, and control plants were sprayed with 0.02% Silwet L77, a surfactant (Lehle Seeds, Round Rock, TX, USA), alone.  Due to the volatile nature of JA, treated and control plants were placed in separate growth chambers after chemical treatment.  Vegetative leaves from plants from each combination of accession and treatment were harvested at 4, 28, and 52 hours post-treatment, and quick-frozen in liquid nitrogen for subsequent RNA extractions. Three plants per accession were bulked for each treatment/time point combination. Each plant was harvested only once. To avoid diurnal variation in gene expression, the time points were 24 hrs apart and harvesting was always performed over a 30 minute period at the same time of day (1:00 PM). ONLY THE SILWET TREATED CONTROL SAMPLES ARE INCLUDED IN THIS SUBMISSION, BECAUSE ONLY THE CONTROL MICROARRAYS WERE USED FOR THIS EXPERIMENT TO DERIVE GENETIC MARKERS.

protocol.name: P-TABM-132
protocol.text: cDNA synthesis was conducted according to the manufacturer’s guidelines in the GeneChip Expression Analysis Technical Manual 701021 rev1 (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA, USA).  Biotin labeling was conducted using an Affymetrix IVT labeling kit.
